arm_group.description: Patients with chronic hepatitis, who experienced HVPG measurement via transjugular approach and EGD within 3 months of HVPG measurement
Patients with liver cirrhosis, who experienced HVPG measurement via transjugular approach and EGD within 3 months of HVPG measurement

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to assess the role of portal hypertension of peptic ulcer disease
      in liver cirrhosis and chronic hepatitis.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Association With Peptic Ulcer Disease and Hepatic Vein Pressure Gradient

detailed_description.textblock:
Retrospective case-control study

        -  Investigators will analyze the medical records of hepatic vein pressure gradient (HVPG)
           and esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) cases who had liver cirrhosis (LC) or chronic
           hepatitis in a single tertiary hospital (Chuncheon Sacred Heart hospital, Korea) within
           2008~2012.

        -  Portal hypertension is assessed using HVPG measurement via transjugular approach.

        -  Peptic ulcer is evaluated through EGD within 3 months of HVPG measurement

        -  The association of Peptic ulcer with LC, chronic hepatitis and total population (LC or
           chronic hepatitis) will be assessed by univariate and multivariate analysis

        -  There is no specific time frame, because this study is retrospective observational
           study, however EGD data is enrolled if it was done within 3 month from HVPG
           measurement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The patients who underwent hepatic vein pressure gradient (HVPG) measurement and
             esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) and also had LC or chronic hepatitis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  The patients who have missing or incomplete HVPG or EGD data

          -  The patients who underwent gastrectomy

          -  The patients who have systemic malignancy

study_pop.textblock:
Investigators will analyze the medical records of hepatic vein pressure gradient (HVPG)
        and esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) cases who had LC or chronic hepatitis in single
        tertiary hospital of Korea.

clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Observational Study of Impact of Portal Hypertension for the Peptic Ulcer in Liver Cirrhosis and Chronic Hepatitis

other_outcome.description: The risk factor of PUD in liver cirrhosis and chronic hepatitis will be assessed, statistically. (NO specific time frame, only confined to 2009 to 2012, when the HVPG measurement was done). Logistic regression analysis will be used to detect the risk factor of LC-PUD and chronic hepatitis-PUD.
other_outcome.measure: The risk factor of PUD in LC and chronic hepatitis
other_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective case-control study (from 2009 to 2012, up to 3 years)

Department of Internal Medicine, Hallym University College of Internal Medicine

primary_outcome.description: The association of hepatic vein pressure gradient that reflects portal hypertension and peptic ulcer disease will be assessed statistically (NO specific time frame, only confined to 2009 to 2012, when the HVPG measurement was done). The student T-test or Mann-Whitney test will be used to evaluate the association between PUD or not and HVPG degree, by SPSS software.
primary_outcome.measure: The association of HVPG and PUD
primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective case-control study (from 2009 to 2012, up to 3 years)
